reviews.review: Everytime I play this game all people want to do is bully me and make fun of me cause I can't play well and everytime I try to get better I still get bullied. There are also so many bugs in this game that people exploit and use and it just makes it feel like it's still in beta. I can't recommend a buggy, break game that punishes news players and won't help or support new players it's a bullshit experience and a waste of money.
died, died again then escaped. followed by more dieing

Concept of this game seems to be alright. But this game is the worst possible outcome this concept could result in. Seriously, don't play this game, if you don't want to waste precious time (and probably money for DLC) as I unfortunately did. The community is toxic. The game itself works against you by bugging / glitching out way too many times (disconnects, more killer than survivor, broken matchmaking etc.) and instead of fixing what should be fixed, the developer push more content for user to pay. And after you met enough toxic players, you get banned, and all the DLC you bought are useless to you.

In the past, I was hoping they would fix at least enough of those problems to have at least a bit fun, but they did not. 
Don't waste your time and money, you can spend it on better things than this.
It is a very fun game to play, it has really fun survivor and killers to play as or against and overall it´s fun.

Cambio la reseña siempre y cuando le hagan un Nerfeo al deterioro, es completamente inútil intentar correr o escapar, está tan des balanceado, que no importa si falla, su recuperación es rápida y sobre todo su ángulo de ataque, es simplemente un cáncer. No recomendaré este juego nunca, hasta que nerfeen al cancer mismo.

Felicidades, si el juego ya estaba muriendo, con esta última actualización lo terminaron de matar, Nerfean a un nivel estúpido a los sobrevivientes, mientras que los killers ahora hacen lo que quieren, como si fuera poco, tienen el descaro de poner a los 2 killers MAS ROTOS DEL JUEGO en el tomo?, BEHAVIOR, NO PUEDEN SER MAS IMBÉCILES.

I've thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of it. Mind you it shows I only have 15 hours logged, but that's on PC. I'm sitting around 300 hours in PS4. I love the availability of character customization with outfits and such. The scream I make sometimes when a Myers comes out of nowhere is appalling to my husband, which just makes this more enjoyable. Sure you get camped, or tunneled; but that is not every match, those are just the ones you lose.  There aren't many bad things to say about the game. Sometimes there's a small glitch or two. Just adds an extra challenge for me; BHVR tends to fix glitches pretty quick compared to some other much larger developers out there *looking at Bethesda*

One of the top 4 games of the last couple years in terms of how fun and unusual the game play is. Has its issues with bugs and imbalanced perks, but overall is still fun to play every time I log on. Game has a robust progression system & cosmetics to keep things fresh to some degree. If you handle stress well & like the idea of cat & mouse game play then this is the one for you. Dead by Daylight is its own niche with nothing else like it really at the moment. It has its flaws, & won't appeal to some people for sure, but its still fun after all the years. For context I've played as a killer for about 300 hours & survivor 500 since release. I still hop on when I get the itch.
There's a good bit to learn mechanically in this game but overall very fun and not that difficult to learn. Bugs here and there every so often but usually get fixed in upcoming patches.
if u have perks the game is fun if u dont then. Uuuuuuuuuuuh oh well

Been playing this game since PS4 release, and switched to PC in 2020. The game was in a very bad state in 2017-2018 (with lagswitching, hitboxes, OP killers, etc.) Years later after still playing DBD I really think they've put an effort to fix their game. The path their going as of right now is really good, with the progression and meta perk rework I really have been having fun again on dead by daylight.

I absolutely love this game, and have been playing for over two years. You get a lot of people who tell you it is unbalanced, sadly it is. It is supposed to be Asymmetrical and sadly it has become survivor sided. However, with the new updates coming, the Devs are working on getting the game back to what it should be. 

My biggest piece of advise for new players is to ignore everyone else in game and play for yourself. You will hear people say survivors try and make up rules, they do. Play what perks and builds work for you. Ignore the salt, ignore the hate and negativity. If you can get passed the bullying, the game itself is amazing. Sadly the community brings it down.

My other piece of advise for new killers is please avoid camping and tunneling. I am a killer main and there is no real benefit to this. You are up against 4 survivors, three of them can pop 3-4 out of 5 gens in the time you spend camping one survivor. Not worth it. Learn to hunt, learn to kick pallets, and gens and smack survivors. You wont win right away, but you will start winning eventually.

I main Bill as survivor, stay out of lockers, go in for SAFE saves, respect your team, break totems, hooks and do gens. Do not crouch around and hide. You need to learn to win by doing the most you can. 

Play around with each character killer or survivor and find your fit but continue to use them all, it helps to know how to juke each killer by playing each killer.

It is trully an amazing game, and if you can get past the haters and crybabies, you can go far. Just takes time and work. ENJOY and SEE YOU IN THE FOG!
If you can accept that it's an asymmetrical game and that it's a bit of a grind to unlock characters with in game currency, you'll have a great time.

Love/hate with this game.
Sucks big when you lose, amazing when you win. No in between.
